title: How many multiples of 5 lie between 1000 and 2000? - Quora

response.answer_text: Me can simply count how many multiples of a number integer  lie between , included, by getting the quotient of . For example: There are  multiples of  between  and . () Now you can count the number of multiples of  between , and between . I will let the rest for you.

Think of it as a arithmetic progression whereby the numbers in the sequence are: 1000,1005,1010…. The formula to find the nth term, Un, in the series is Un = a + (n-1)d where a is the first term and d is the common difference between each term. Subbing in the values, you get 2000 = 1000 + (n-1)(5) ==> n = [(2000–1000)/5]+1 = 201. Alternatively you can think of the number of terms from 1 to 10 that are multiples of 1, you get 10 = difference/multiple + 1.
